dialog.title: Create question set with AI (4 steps)
dialog.intro:
This dialog guides you step by step through four tabs:
1) Create question set: use the prompt, generate JSON, and save the set.
2) Learning objectives: use the prompt, generate Markdown, and save the learning objectives.
3) QA of the question set: give the set + prompt to the AI, save the optimized JSON.
4) QA of the learning objectives: give learning objectives + optimized set to the AI, save the learning objectives, and start the test.
dialog.prompt_guide: For MC tests in this app use the Anki prompt. It is tailored to the app‚Äôs JSON format. You only need the Kahoot/arsnova prompts for exports to those platforms.
dialog.upload_info: ‚ÑπÔ∏è Your set is public. Temp sets last {hours} hrs (or {days} days if reserved).
dialog.uploader_mode: How do you want to add your set?
dialog.uploader_help: Must match format. Max 30 questions, max 5 MB.
dialog.alternative_caption: Paste the JSON output from your AI here.
dialog.status_error_friendly_json: Could not process the file. Please check JSON syntax (structure, quotes, commas).
dialog.status_error_friendly_generic: Save failed. Please check your input and try again.
dialog.lo_optional_info: Optional: Upload learning objectives in the "Lernziele" tab or confirm you want to start without them.
dialog.learning_objectives_caption: Use the prompt on this tab, send it together with the question set to your AI, and upload or paste the generated learning objectives as Markdown.
dialog.learning_objectives_hint_save_first: Save your question set first, then upload the learning objectives.
dialog.learning_objectives_mode: How do you want to add the learning objectives?
dialog.learning_objectives_paste_caption: Paste the learning objectives as Markdown here.
dialog.learning_objectives_help: We auto-name the file to match your set.
dialog.learning_objectives_success: Learning objectives saved as {filename}. They appear via the learning objectives button for your set.
dialog.questionset_caption: Here you create and save your MC question set as JSON. Without a saved set, you cannot continue with learning objectives.
dialog.questionset_next_step: Next step: create the learning objectives in the ‚ÄúLearning objectives‚Äù tab.
dialog.learning_objectives_save_set_first: Please save your question set first in the ‚ÄúCreate question set‚Äù tab.
dialog.learning_objectives_next_qa_button: ‚û°Ô∏è Continue to QA of the question set
dialog.postproduction_caption: Give the prompt and question set to the AI, receive optimized JSON, save it, and continue to QA of the learning objectives.
dialog.postproduction_set_for_ai_caption: Download the question set and give it to the AI together with the prompt.
dialog.postproduction_paste_caption: Paste the AI‚Äôs optimized JSON here and save it.
dialog.postproduction_json_parse_warning: Note: The JSON is not valid yet ({error}).
dialog.postproduction_overwrite_warning: A temporary question set titled ‚Äú{title}‚Äù already exists. Overwrite it?
dialog.postproduction_overwrite_required: Please confirm the overwrite before saving.
dialog.postproduction_next_lo_button: ‚û°Ô∏è Continue to QA of the learning objectives
dialog.postproduction_lo_caption: Give the optimized set and learning objectives to the AI, save the optimized learning objectives, and start the test.
dialog.postproduction_lo_inputs_caption: Download the optimized set and current learning objectives and give both to the AI.
dialog.postproduction_lo_paste_caption: Paste the optimized learning objectives as Markdown here.
dialog.postproduction_lo_not_found: No learning objectives have been saved for this question set yet.
dialog.postproduction_lo_need_set: Please complete the QA of the question set in the ‚ÄúQA of the question set‚Äù tab first.
dialog.postproduction_lo_need_save: Please save the learning objectives before starting.
dialog.intro_info: Quick recap: JSON is the text format for the question set, Markdown is the text format for learning objectives. QA means quality review and improvement. The AI (e.g., ChatGPT or Gemini) generates or improves content based on the prompts.
dialog.questionset_save_success: Question set saved. You can now create and upload the learning objectives in the ‚ÄúLearning objectives‚Äù tab.
dialog.questionset_save_error: Question set could not be saved: {error}

onboarding_tip.title: How navigation works
onboarding_tip.body:
- Skip: park the question; it returns automatically.
- Bookmark: pin it in the sidebar for a quick jump back.
- Panic: time is low; cooldowns are off; Skip and Submit stay available.

recommend.significant_delay: Whoops, delaying! Speed up or skip hard ones.
recommend.behind: You're behind. Try to speed up {degree}.

test_view.panic_mode_active: ‚ö° **Panic Mode:** Cooldowns disabled due to time pressure.

mode_info.exam: üèÜ **Exam Mode:** The clock is ticking! Feedback will be shown at the end.
mode_info.practice: üßò **Practice Mode:** No time pressure. Immediate feedback after every question.

zuspruch.learning_process: Not perfect ‚Äì just part of learning.
zuspruch.read_explanation: Incorrect ‚Äì read the explanation, it helps.
zuspruch.missed_but_persist: Missed ‚Äì but you're still in it.
zuspruch.score_strong: Score is fine ‚Äì one error won't hurt.
zuspruch.keep_rate_high: Rate is good ‚Äì don't sweat it.
zuspruch.overall_performance: Great overall performance ‚Äì keep it up.

audit_logging.privacy_details:
**Retention:** Logs are automatically deleted after 90 days.
**Access:** Only admin users can view logs.
**Export:** CSV export possible for external archiving.

metrics_glossary.answers: **Answers**: Total number of answers given for this question.
metrics_glossary.correct_percentage: **Correct (%)**: Percentage of correct answers (difficulty index ). A value close to 100% means an easy question, a value close to 0% means a difficult question.
metrics_glossary.discrimination: **Discrimination (r_it)**: Correlation between correctly answering this question and the overall test result.
metrics_glossary.discrimination_high: : The question discriminates well between strong and weak participants.
metrics_glossary.discrimination_low: : The question discriminates poorly. It may be confusing, too easy/difficult, or have an error in the answer.

admin.manage_question_owner: ‚úèÔ∏è Quality Assurance (Set creator ‚Äî temporary sets, Human-in-the-Loop)
admin.manage_question_admin: ‚úèÔ∏è Quality Assurance (Admin ‚Äî main collection / Core sets)
admin.json_schema_help_text:
Short & clear:

Edit only the text VALUE ‚Äî the content inside the quotation marks after the colon.
Do not change field names, brackets, commas, or structure.

Buttons (what they do):
- Verify & Save: Runs the validator and saves the edited question if no errors are found. If there are validation errors, saving is blocked and errors are shown.
- Save despite warnings: If validation produced warnings (non-blocking), this button forces a save despite those warnings. Use with care.
- Publish to main collection: Copies the current set into the main `data/` collection and creates a backup first; this publishes the set to the official collection.
- Reset to source JSON: Reloads the original question from the source file and restores the editor content to that original JSON.
- Cancel: Discards unsaved edits and closes the editor expander.

Note: Clicking action buttons (Save/Reset/Cancel/Publish) keeps the editor open so you can continue editing. To close the editor, click 'Close' or collapse the expander manually.

Example (only edit the marked part):
"question": "What is 2+2?"  ‚Üê change the text between the quotes

Important:
- Change only the values inside quotes (e.g. "question": "New question text").
- Do not change field names (e.g. "question"), list structure ("options": [...] ), or numeric fields ("answer": 0).
- After saving: briefly test the question to ensure it still works.

If unsure: fix typos or send feedback.
admin.reset_success: Reset to original JSON in source file.
admin.promote_help: Copies the set into the main collection and creates a backup first. This publishes the set to the official collection.
admin.promote_exists_info: A file named {new_filename} already exists in the main collection. The existing file was backed up as {backup_name} and has been replaced with your file.
admin.promote_success: Set successfully published to main collection as {new_filename}! (Backup: {backup_name})
admin.delete_help: Irreversibly deletes this question from the set.
admin.delete_confirm_warning: Are you sure? This question will be deleted immediately.

confidence.hint_underconfidence: Underconfidence: {percent}% of your judgments were unsure but correct. Tip: trust your knowledge a bit more.

cognition_radar.explanation_short:
Radar shows correct % per cognitive stage (Bloom).

Patterns:
‚Ä¢ Cramming (Spike at Reproduction): Good memory, weak application ‚Üí Practice transfer.
‚Ä¢ Surface: Concepts known, usage fails ‚Üí Use case studies.
‚Ä¢ Practical: Good app, theory gaps ‚Üí Refresh basics.
‚Ä¢ Analytical: Strong solver, basic gaps ‚Üí Review fundamentals.
‚Ä¢ Balanced: Solid all-rounder ‚Üí Keep it up!

topic_chart.caption: Share per topic (100% = all questions in topic)
topic_chart.title: Performance by Topic

info.early_finish: Finished {early_delta} min early. Time: {duration_display}. Limit ({tempo_label}): {allowed_min} min

subheader.topic_performance: Where Do You Stand on Each Topic?

summary_view.performance_explanation_expander: üí° Why Does This Diagram Help You?
summary_view.performance_explanation_content:
**How to use this diagram for your learning:**

‚úÖ **Recognize your strengths** ‚Äì Where do you already master the content confidently?

üéØ **Identify knowledge gaps** ‚Äì Which topics deserve more attention?

üìä **Understand the context** ‚Äì Numbers (X/Y) show: attempted / total questions

üîç **Check reliability** ‚Äì The more questions you‚Äôve attempted, the more accurate your picture.

üí™ **Plan strategically** ‚Äì Focus on areas with the greatest learning potential!
summary_view.performance_no_data_info: Once you work on questions, you'll see your topic-specific learning progress here.

cognition_radar.name: Cognitive Levels (Bloom)
cognition_radar.header: Your Thinking Processes at a Glance
cognition_radar.explanation_expander: üí° Why Does This Radar Help You?
cognition_radar.explanation_content:
This radar shows which cognitive levels you're working on (Bloom's Taxonomy):

**The Levels Overview:**

‚Ä¢ **Reproduction** = Recalling and reproducing knowledge

‚Ä¢ **Application** = Using learned material in new situations

‚Ä¢ **Analysis** = Recognizing connections and penetrating problems



**Typical Learner Profiles:**

üéì **The Theorist**

Strong reproduction, weaker application.

You know the concepts, but applying them in practical situations is still challenging.

*Learning recommendation:* Practice with case studies and transfer tasks.



üîß **The Practitioner**

Strong application, weaker reproduction.

You work well with knowledge, but theoretical foundations could be strengthened.

*Learning recommendation:* Review definitions and core concepts for confidence.



üîç **The Analyst**

Strong analysis, irregular foundation.

You think holistically and recognize connections well, but may have gaps in fundamentals.

*Learning recommendation:* Systematically verify that all basics are solid.



‚≠ê **The All-Rounder**

Balanced profile across all levels.

You activate various thinking processes evenly ‚Äì excellent!

*Learning recommendation:* Keep it up, fine-tune where needed.



**Important:** Reliability grows with the number of questions attempted.

summary_view.performance_column_explanation_expander: üí° Why Does This Analysis Help You?
summary_view.performance_column_explanation_content:
**How to use this analysis for your learning:**

üü¢ **Understood** ‚Äì You can apply these concepts confidently. Well done!

üî¥ **Not understood** ‚Äì Misconceptions likely exist here. These are your most valuable learning opportunities!

‚ö™ **Not attempted** ‚Äì You haven‚Äôt tested these concepts yet.

**Your next step:** Focus on the red areas. They show you exactly where deeper engagement brings the greatest learning progress. Resolving misconceptions is often more effective than accumulating new knowledge!
summary_view.difficulty_map_explanation_expander: üí° Why Does This Map Help You?
summary_view.difficulty_map_explanation_content:
**How to use this map for your learning:**

üó∫Ô∏è **Recognize patterns** ‚Äì Which topics are easy or difficult for you at which cognitive level?

üéØ **Find precise starting points** ‚Äì Row √ó Column = exactly where you should practice

üìä **Understand the colors:**
‚Ä¢ Green (>75%) = You master this area well
‚Ä¢ Yellow (50-75%) = Room for improvement
‚Ä¢ Red (<50%) = Priority for your learning
‚Ä¢ Gray = Not yet attempted

üîç **Note n=X/Y** ‚Äì Shows attempted/total questions. Color reflects BOTH: quality AND completeness!

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important:** Unanswered questions = 0 points. Example: 2/4 attempted, both correct = 50% (yellow), not 100%!

üí° **Your learning advantage:** You can see at a glance whether difficulties are topic-related OR thinking-process-related. This helps you choose the right learning strategy!
